review: So... my experience at this location was a delight. Our waiter was so friendly and courteous. He always checked up on us if we needed anything.  Food... was better than expected. I think TGI Fridays is better than chilies. My Mac and cheese is good and the Jack Daniels burger was very good. My friends got mostly chicken entrees and they were satisfied with their meal.  Great atmosphere and clean place. The service was amazing and our food was good. I will give 4 stars for now. Really good food and will come back after a day at six flags.

I must say i was impressed by this location. My husband and I arrived and there was a wait, shortly after we sat and waiter took our orders, super friendly staff and organized. Took our orders and was in top of out table to ensure we were OK. Prices are not bad for what we had. I have a great time/experience which is hard to say for chain restaurants. Did  it visit lavatory so I cannot comment. Place was clean and good flow when they are busy which is important. I reccomend this location.

I don't normally comment on large chains as they are pretty cookie cutter establishments. This visit was a repeat of an earlier sitting in August. Same loud, inattentive bar tender. Staff sitting around a side bar table being loud and acting like children.--with a manager standing next to them... Last time we cancelled our drink orders as we had nothing brought that we ordered after 15 min. I often wonder how a mega Chain like this can ever close, especially in this area. However, I remember an Applebees being here when I first moved here. Too bad.
Worst service ever! Been in there twice now and decided to leave both times due to their service. I would recommend not going to this location off of Grand at all costs!

The food did not come out in a timely matter, ran out of pecan chicken salad. Wrong soup came out. Husband ordered a burger instead, had to take it home.  The poor girl is the one that had to say sorry 6 times. No credit.  Not busy at all. I have lived out in this area for a long time, WOW has it gone way down hill!!!!!

Called ahead for call ahead seating. When there was no wait. Got here 10 minutes later to be told there's a 20 minute wait. No phone calls were taken around that time and they don't do call ahead. What a waste of a drive.

My husband and I typically love going to TGI Fridays, and usually, we dine in. Tonight, we both had a particularly long day and a longer night ahead of us so we decided to order carry out and we were very disappointed with our food. First of all, we ordered buffalo wings and they were basically inedible because each one was bloody inside. We also got two entrees: the grilled salmon and the 10oz sirloin. We asked for the rice to be substituted to the mashed potato for the salmon meal and we still got the rice and we asked for the sirloin to be medium rare and it was closer to well done than it was to medium. I'm not quite sure if it was because it was carry out that was the issue because we have never had this experience when dining it. It's a shame.

I haven't eaten inside the restaurant in a couple of years however we did a takeout service and it wasn't that great. We were supposed to get a full slab of rib for their half-price special, we only got a half slab of ribs. They completely missed the sides, ! 2 sides were completely missing on two of the four orders, and on a 3rd order they gave the wrong side.

I love fridays and was extremely disappointed with this location.  Service was slow, our waitress was not good.  Food took forever to come out and mine had clearly been sitting under the heat lamps for a while since some of my noodles were crunchy.  My chicken was beyond dry and my daughters burgers were awful.  I would have complained but it was busy and my daughter was falling asleep at the table.  The manager was by the door while my husband and I were leaving with daughter in arms and he yelled at his staff to hold the door (loud enough where a customer thought he was talking to her!).  Awful experience.

Service was nonexistent. The hostess was in a corner that we couldn't see when we walked in and didn't greet us. We had to figure out who to ask for help. She rolled her eyes when we asked how long it would be. 15-20 minutes. A half hour later, we've been staring at four empty tables, three of them have been empty for twenty minutes, and nobody's being seated at them. We ask the manager, and he says "we'll get to you when we can." Other people were giving up and leaving, and eventually we did, too. A lot of money walked out the door that afternoon aside from our own lunch.

To start, we waited over a half hour to be seated when the place was practically empty. It was pouring outside, so we just decided to wait it out. Then we were served cold food. When we asked for boxes for the food we clearly hadn't eaten, we were given the smallest boxes available. Our entire plates were full and we had to cram our items into the boxes. There was no apology, no offer to send the manager over though we did see our server speaking to the manager. It was unclear if they were ever made aware of the situation and by the unenthused look on their face while walking around the restaurant the manager probably wouldn't have been much help anyway. Won't be going back. $30 for food that is mediocre at best even when served correctly isn't worth the trouble.
Great place to come to after a day of shopping! Endless apps are on point and the burgers delicious. Manny, our waiter, gave us the best service we've had in a WHILE. Keep it up

TGIF in Gurnee service is going down a slippery slope. Some of the bartenders are rude and unprofessional. Even management is unprofessional they carry over their bad day into the restaurants. Their focus isn't on customer satisfaction anymore it's directed elsewhere. Because the quality of food & service is affecting operations..

I had the Jack Daniel's Chicken with mac & cheese and fries. Literally everything was awfully. The food tasted like it was fresh out of the microwave and the chicken tasted like rubber. The best thing I had was my glass of water.

4/16/17: This visit was worse as compared to then.   At first impression the menus are filthy dirty and falling apart. (I will try and post a photo).   As for the meal let's start with the easiest thing to prepare: pot stickers, they were dry and shriveled in appearance - either over nuked or sat in the window too long. There was no sear on the bottom and was discolored almost as if they spilled some of the sauce on them while it sat in the window. The wings were okay but most of the sauce was on the plate and not tossed properly.  The parmesan crusted chicken was rubbery / fleshy in texture and had an odd taste. It wasn't spoiled it just had odd flavors.  The chicken fingers were stringy, salty, and dry. I'm assuming they no longer hand batter them to order anymore. They had the texture, taste, and appearance of being prepared and frozen.  I mean this whole heartidly I serioulsy wished we went to Wendy's. The meal would have been so much better. Never again will this restaurant be an option under any circumstances. Our waiter Jordan (I think) was very attentive and polite - he was the only positive part of the meal. We still tipped him well. We almost felt sorry that his tips are dependent on that poor, low quality food.

I love this location! It's my go-to place for dinner with friends or a spontaneous family dinner.  TGIF food is a level better than chili's or UNOs or Applebee's. I feel like their food is much more "trendy" with new flavor fusions.  I come here for after party food with friends like I did for prom, homecoming, get togethers and all that because they're open late. Plus, their reward system is THE BEST out there.

I used to work for a Fridays and have always liked them but this was a terrible experience!  I ordered the strawberry fields chicken salad along with three other orders and when I got home-No Grilled Chicken on my salad!! I called and the told me I had specifically say I wanted to add chicken.  That is not true Bobbie.  You can order without out chicken if you ask, but it comes standard with chicken.  He offered me a free app and kept trying to make it seem like my fault.  No thanks Bobbie.  Never eating there again.  The only thing worse than a wrong order is a bad manager who blames the customer!!!!

Well, the food was so-so, but the service/bartender was just terrible. Sat at the bar, no more than 5 people at one time. Dirty dishes sat next to me the entire time.  Dirty plates in front of me for about 10 min before I asked for him to take it away, along with the other dirty dishes I was looking at for 45 minutes. Very slow and inattentive. No wonder the place was empty.

The hostess and manager were unable to seat us and another waiting couple, although there were apparently 10 open tables in plain sight. The hostess had a bad attitude and mumbled every word she said through her teeth. What a waste of time.

It's prepared food. No such thing as "chef" in a place like this. Lots of artificial flavors, colors, preservatives, all pre-ordered to be microwaved. It's a franchise crap food place that leaves me with a belly ache. When I was young I thought  this was the bomb, I'm older and wiser now and have been eating home grown and locally organically raised farm meat. Man, can I taste the difference between fake food and real food. This place's food made me sick.
What a perfect way to end a vacation! The waiter was very nice, the endless appetizers were great and my friends got me drunk! Loved it!

Glad I came and gave them another try.   It has been over 8 years since I've been to a TGIF on account my past experience has proven they were just a lousy place to come to... poor servers dishing out lousy food.  The menu, not surprisingly has changed over the years and I find more accommodating.    The server was upbeat, knew the menu, gave suggestions and was very tentative to our modifications to the menu items when ordering.  He came back to the table frequently and was able to balance well on being attentive and yet not bothersome.     The appetizer and main meal came out with good timing (nothing worse than getting the appetizer and two minutes later getting the main meal).  Each dish presented well, was to order, and at the temperatures you would expect.  Most importantly, it was very good!!    Granted, this is a chain store, so it can change from location to location, but as I mentioned, it has been some time since I've come to one and this location has changed my tune.    So, if you're in the area, I would highly suggest giving this location a try... perhaps I'll see ya there!

TGI Fridays to me is like any other chained restaurants so I wasn't to excited about their food.  When we arrived with a party of 6, we waited about 10mins before being seated. I ordered a Chicken Salad which was huge for me.  It taste like any other chicken salad.  My family ordered some Burgers (sorry, I forget which burger) and they liked it.  They said it was very flavorful and juicy.   Overall, it was an okay experience.  The waitress was nice but she wasn't great.  She didn't refill our drinks until we asked for it.  On the day we went, when you order a Burger, you get a free one the next time you come back.  We ordered a burger to go while we were half way done with our food, and they gave it to us as our free one.  We didn't expect that, that was nice of the waitress to do that.

We didn't go to Fridays expecting exceptional service or wow-me food but for something quick enough and a consistent flavor. Fortunately for us, we ended up with a guy named John as our server and everything went uphill from there. Our server, John, didn't do anything crazy like blow up balloon animals or breathe fire. What he did was better. He was attentive, informative, intelligent about the food, casually inviting during our experience and engaged our 3 year old like a seasoned pro.  We recently moved to the area and have been eating out a lot lately. We've encountered an array of mediocre and sub-par service wherever we've gone, unfortunately. Last night, we chose Fridays on a passing whim and I'm glad we did.  Our food was pretty tasty; we appreciated the reduction in meal sizes from the last time we visited a Fridays. Despite a couple of small "meh" things (menus were dirty and my beverage tasted flat like the tap line wasn't clean) - it was all overshadowed by John's awesome.  Even watching his interactions with the other tables around us reaffirmed how good he is at what he does - which is make their Fridays experience a memorable one.  We'll definitely be back more often now because of John.

Went out for a nice dinner with two family members and my friend. The waiter came by to clean our table and didn't greet us. He asked us to remove our phones so he could wipe it down. Came back to ask for our order of drinks, never told us his name. He all around had a terrible mood. My sister in law asked for a side of jack Daniels sauce that was brought to her along with her food by a waitress. This is when the evening got worst. When the waitress turned to leave the side of jack Daniels fell to the ground as the waitress had left it close to the edge of the table. Some splashed on my sister in law's jeans. It also splashed on the couple's items next to us sitting at the bar. They became upset as it is rightfully so. The gentleman stated his shirt was a hundred dollar shirt and began to be rude to us. I was quick to correct him in his unnecessary statements towards us. No employee ever bothered to come clean the mess that a few customers continued to step on and over. No employee came to offer anyone an apology. I had to ask for another jack Daniels sauce and when I did ask I was given unnecessary negative attitude by the waiter. At one point I saw his eyes roll. Needless the expectations have gone terribly down. I've been coming to this place for many years and it has sadly disappointed me more than ever.

Service was excellent and our food tasted good. Usually I like TGI Fridays and they have good promotional offers, coupons, drink specials, etc. My complaint lies within the Bourbon Barrel Chicken. You literally get a mini chicken breast on a wooden board about the size of a roofing shingle for $13.00. Would I come back? Yeah, but I probably wouldn't order this again.

Some of the slowest service I have ever experienced. We waited 15 minutes to order an appetizer. Almost 15 more minutes to order entrees and another 30 minutes to get our food (some of which was cold).  The waiter never came to ask if we needed anything other than when he brought the food and gave us the check.  I will personally never be returning to this location.

Went here for lunch yesterday and wasn't impressed - most of the food was good (bacon mac'n'cheese bites, corned beef sliders and Thai pork tacos stand out),  some was poor (the ribs were overcooked and mushy) and the service was really bad. We sat in the bar area so we could watch the games - it was not even 1/4 full, yet it took 10 minutes for her to take our drink order and another 15 to return with them.  We then ordered a variety of apps and entrees, informing her that the apps were to be served at the same time as the entrees because they were apps for those people and not sharing with the table. Our plates came out one at a time over the next 30 minutes - the apps didn't even come out at the same time!  Plus, to make things worse (if that can actually occur) our drink glasses were empty for so long we had to get up and go to the bar to get refills.

Mediterranean mahi mahi naan'wich was very good and sweet potato fries yummy. Chicken Cobb salad was fresh, and had moist and flavorful chicken. Most importantly, our server Megan, was exceptionally attentive to restrictions and very helpful in assuring the food was prepared appropriately. I really appreciate that extra care and attention!

There's nothing particularly wrong with the food or service here. It's quite busy and very popular with families and boozers who want to whoop it up barside. The food is fine, the drinks are fine, and the service is a bit slow. What really gives me pause about the place is having to wait to get a table on a weeknight because there are so many families with kids. It's not really a good value if you have drinks. I'm skeptical about casual dining establishments which don't print prices for drinks on the menu. Beware of this practice. Two house margaritas and a special value entree with appetizer and entree with dessert had my total bill with tip upwards of $40 just for me. I want more for my money. On the plus side, the hosts and hostesses are very friendly.

Arrived at 3:45 pm, got seated right away no problem. Got our water no problem. Told Waitress need a couple of minutes to decide and that started problem.  After about 5 minutes we had decided what to get and we saw the waitress go by without giving us a glance. Our menus were closed which I believe signifies that the customer is ready to order.  At 4:10 pm we had had enough and left. Mentioned our problem to the staff at the door and they smiled and said sorry never offered to get the manager.  Last time we will visit this facility.

Salmon was good, but sweet potato fries were extra salty. Lots of salt left on the plate.  Tomato and mozzarella salad also way over salted. I'll get ribs next time. My buddy picked the Jack Daniel ribs clean.

Words cannot explain how bad our waiter was! Never again will I go there, never! His attitude towards us was so negative and shameful. His tone of voice was beyond rude. My friends and I were so so disappointed with this man. By far the worst experience ever!

Amazing dinner!  Sizzling steak and spinach.  One of the best meals I've ever ate.  Excellent service by Ashley.  I highly recommend.  I will come back again.  Oh and the Tropical Raspberry Tea was to die for.

Happy Thanksgiving! I came here to get a decent meal after my family cancelled dinner. I ordered the Jack Daniels Rib Eye and Shrimp. This steak was terrible.. Tough and cold.. I ordered it rate too, and it was at best a medium. I'm really surprised for a $25 entree. The bar manager Tony offered me a free appetizer for next time, but I won't use it. Heck I'm over it. I won't be spending anymore money here. Not again Friday's, this is a fail.

Worst dining experience I ever had.  Waited 40 minutes for cold appetizer that we didn't eat.  They claimed the kitchen was a little behind.  The restaurant was not even have full.  Manager came over and said they are not busy and there is no excuse.  They said they would give us appetizers after our dinner.  Manager came over and acted like he was doing us a favor by not charging us for food we didn't eat.  Food came and I asked the manager for a side of mayo.  He never came back!!!!!!  Forget the mayo, it was another 20 minutes before the waitress came back.  We were completely ignored after this point.  We had to get up and ask the manager for to go containers.  Waited another 20 minutes for the check.  Check came and they did not apply the coupon.  Left for 15 minutes to revise check.  Overcharged for drinks, had to be revised again.  Didn't deduct enough for the coupon, need to be revised again.  I told the waitress To thank the manager for blowing me off.  Manager finally came over with 3rd revised check and apologized.  I told him that with all the problems, he should have made sure the rest of our dining experience was perfect.  I told him this was the worst experience I ever had.  Frankly, he could care less.  He put the check in front of me and walked away.  Unbelievable!!!!!!!

Stopped here for 1/2 price appetizers. Ordered the mozzarella sticks and Jack Daniel's chicken strips. Food was very good and fast. The Jack Daniel's strips are always good. However the service was nothing to be desired. My soda was kept refilled but other than that the bartenders gave me the impression they could care less about me and about them being there. I waited 20 minutes until someone checked on me to which I waited and waited for my bill. Food was great, place was clean but the service was below average.

Probably the worst location of this chain restaurant I've ever been to.  We enjoyed going for the all-you-can eat appetizer special nationally promoted by the chain.  We went several times and enjoyed the appetizers of our choice.  Then on our third visit we were told that the management of the Gurnee location decided to not offer the all-you-can eat appetizer special, the only reason we chose this restaurant that night.  We stayed away for quite a while but then returned and were surprised to find the appetizer special back on the menu.  We each picked one at a time and shared with the waitress taking our next order when delivering the current order.  This visit we were asked one time for another order then left sitting with no visits from the waitress for probably 20 minutes.  When she finally came back we were annoyed and decided to just get our bill and leave.  When we asked for boxes for our leftovers we were told that we could not bring home our leftovers.  We each had 2 appetizers at a cost of $12 per person.  We could have ordered individual appetizers for the table for less than $36 and been able to bring home our leftovers.  She finally conceded on this point after stating it was not allowed.  I was paying  for the food in front of us so what was the problem.  They more than made their profit on us.  She brought us the check at which time I was told I could not use my points for $8 off our bill because the appetizer promotion was considered to be a discounted meal.  This was after the waitress showed me earlier before we ordered our meal how to find my points and commit to using them thereby putting a 30 day time clock on my use of the committed points, points that I would not be allowed to use for the current meal.  Needless to say I  will not return to the Gurnee location.  It was an expensive mistake I won't make again.

I don't know what it is about Gurnee and theme based restaurants/bars, but many of them really are below average. At this location, I experienced poor service and not so good food. Not that TGIF's has ever been impressive, this location executes poorly.

Friday's has always been one of my favorite restaurants. Love the food and drinks. Problem is management isn't keeping up with the things that need to be replaced. Bathrooms smell like Porta potties. Bar staff is usually great every so often I will get a over poured drink but they are always so nice and kind.

Could not believe the terrible service we were given on 6/28. Our server was Crystal (we sat in the bar) and we placed our drink orders (2 cocktails and 2 shots) and our appetizer at the same time. Our appetizer came out before any of our drinks. I had to stare down the manager before he finally came over and we asked for our drinks. Came back with our cocktails, and still no shots. We waited about 30 minutes before they came out. We could never find our server, and it seemed like the manager could not be bothered to make sure our stay was good. We got the check and we were surprised to see we were charged for the shots. Both of us are in the industry and thought they would have comped something, or discounted for the service. But, nope. We were 1 of three tables that complained about the service. Very disappointed.

Ate dinner here tonight at 10:00. Food was decent but service was HORRIBLE. It was not that busy but it took our server Gabby 15-20 minutes to come to our table. By that time we were ready to order food as well as our drinks. Another 20 minutes went by. No drinks no server. We had to ask another server to get ours. 5 mins later she arrives and she finally seems to get it into gear after mentioning how long we've been waiting even just for drinks. Food came after waiting another 20 minutes. Server is missing in action again. It continues the same way until we leave. We spent a total of 2 hours there.  Service sucks. Will never be back.
Service stinks, slow, food was cold. Lots of staff standing around including the manager. Second time in a row it was like this. Very slow

It took 20 minutes to get seated, but when we got to our table it was dirty. The receptionist wiped it with her hand and thought that it would be okay?! SMH. Service is below standards, you can tell that from the tables around you that are still waiting to be cleaned from previous customers. Management needs to take a look how things are being run.

I'm sorry, this place was just awful. Our waitress saw us 3 times while we were there, and each interaction she was very abrupt and gave us very little attention. My mother waited 30 minutes for a cold appetizer she ordered for her main meal, and despite letting our waitress know that she intended to have it as an entree it still came out 10-15 minutes before my turkey burger. I asked for my burger to be done medium well and it was white it the middle. White. (If you haven't seen a turkey burger before, they are NOT supposed to appear white, so basically my food was either microwaved or severely freezer burned or something). The bun was soggy and gross. Our celery that came with the appetizer plate was ancient and turning white on the ends. My mother asked for bleu cheese with her food and got ranch. We waited 10 minutes for our drinks. 20 for refills. The manager was running around like a chicken with its head cut off and despite letting our waitress know that we had an awful experience we were given no apology, no one took responsibility for the awful meal, and we paid full price for inedible, cold 'food'. Next time you're in Gurnee, i would recommend the local mall's food court before this decrepit eatery.

ROBBIE BOCK IS A BARTENDING GOD! My best friend and I came in to see how the Happy Hour 4-7pm would be. We got amazing drinks and Robbie is hilarious. A bartender who adds to the charm of the bar is rare and Robbie is the charm of this bar! Friday's has amazing prices and chips and salsa to snack on while you sip a few martinis on Monday!
Great place to hang out, they need to slow down cause we need more time to eat that we are given.
Best Fridays eveeerrr! Toni was absolutely amazing! Also Sam was incredible! Sad to hear hey are both leaving!

This place would've had four stars if it wasn't for the couple mess-ups on my receipts.  Friday's is my go-to place for a good meal and some drinks on special. Mondays and Wednesdays are my favorite days to go for drinks because they've got a lot of good drinks for only $3 that are normally around $8. Today I had a couple appletinis which were made very well - not too strong nor too sweet.  Whenever I go to Friday's, I usually order their 6oz. sirloin steak. For only $11 and two sides, this is a great meal! I always ask for my steak medium rare, but it always comes back a little more medium (which I don't mind). It's still better than a lot of places that serve steak and you're not really breaking your wallet here. My servers are always super nice, and I've never waited long for a seat when it's crowded (max: 15 minutes). In all my time coming here, I've only ever had one bad server. He was rude and forgot about my table constantly.  Today, I was just there for drinks and an appetizer. During the week, they've got appetizers on special when you eat at the bar. Their bar area has booths, which is really nice! I had the bacon wrapped jalapeños. I liked them although they were somewhat bland. The bacon was really sweet and it was only $5. When my server handed me the receipt, he made a mistake of charging my appetizer full price. When I brought it up, he was really sorry. This has happened to me twice at this location, but the other time was ages ago.  They've got Bingo on Sundays, which is always a hoot. But I've got to say, this is one of my favorite places to grab drinks with friends.
Eating in the bar and totally under staffed and slow. Terrible service.  We thought it would be faster.

I love the Sizzling Chicken and Spinach Dinner.  It is a healthy option and it is AMAZE-BALLS! Every once in a while I get something different, mahi-mahi, cajun chicken past, etc... and Everything on the menu is great. As a BONUS they Make good drinks, have great drink specials throughout the week and have tasty beer on Tap.

The highlight of the meal was my Pink Punk Martini. It was on a $6 special, and pretty strong. I have a fairly high tolerance for alcohol and one drink got me buzzed.  If like to start by saying that I think there should be a better method for the all you can eat APPS. They would have to charge my two children (10,and 4) $12 each to share the endless appetizers. I understand why there's a rule. But really, my kids don't eat much. Maybe a few bites. It was cheaper for me to just order two separate appetizers (and we didn't even eat them all). It'd be wonderful if they maybe did a $5 charge for kids instead of full price.  Anyway, onto the food.  Spinach dip- Good. Better than others.  Pretzel w cheese dip- bland. Disappointing.  New York Strip- Under seasoned, lacked flavor, and quality. Was cooked correctly.  Mozzarella & Tomatoes- good.  Fresh Spinach- Good.  Burger- asked for it cooked medium and it literally came back burnt. No, seriously. Burnt. They made a new one. Daughter enjoyed the second.  Brownie Sundae- Really Good.  All in all it was a okay meal. I just know not to order steal from here. I'll stick to the Ribs next time.

This is the third time we've gone to this location in the past year & it will be the last. Every time we've gone the service has been ridiculously slow, even when they aren't really busy. This last time though was THE worst. It was kind of busy but nothing crazy, after we were seating it took almost 5 minutes for our waitress to come over then another 7 minutes to get 1 Coke (we also ordered 2 slushes) that "were being made." That's ridiculous. So when my Coke came we said "screw it" & left. Which sucks because we love the good. This place needs to get new staff that can actually do their job. We ended up at Uno's right around the corner & had fast, friendly service & delicious food.

HORRIBLE SERVICE!! Never again will I be going back!! I've been here four times, and all four times the service was horrible. I go just for the Cajun shrimp and chicken pasta.  They didn't greet me at the door and The hosts are always saying " I don't care" about seating people. Rude! I felt disrespected and a lack of professionalism because of my skin color. My 4 year olds kids menu was tossed on to the table and they forgot to give him crayons so he went back and threw them on the table!! It didn't bug me that he forgot the crayons, I could get passed that, but to throw them to him instead of placing them on the table. NEVER AGAIN! We do not need to be treated that way!! No one does!
Great food, service, and management. Overall pleasant experience. Will be back again!!

I went there last week with my boyfriend and we sat at a bar table. It took about 10 minutes to be greeted by the server and we ordered a sangria and a blueberry lemonade drink that took literally 15 minutes to get to the table. Then we ordered our food... the burger with wings that was cooked medium and the sizzlin chicken and shrimp. About 25 minutes after ordering, a food runner served my food which should have been done after the burger considering it was shrimp. Not only was my served food first, I also didn't have silverware on the table so that took ten minutes to receive. Five minutes later, the burger was finally served, cold along with the fries being cold. I've never been this upset with service. I myself am a server and I made it clear to my server that I came here to eat with my boyfriend, not without him. She knew I was upset and ASKED if id like her to get the manager... well you don't ask in that situation, you just get the manager when there is problem after problem from the minute you walk in. I will never visit this TGI Fridays as it is very unorganized and the management needs to 're evaluate their servers.

They recently hired a bunch of new servers. My boyfriend and I come here often and we always ask for Art. He's a phenomenal server, always busy but makes us feel welcome every visit. Sad to see Robbie move away as well but if you must go here, ask for Art!

Last night me and 5 of my freinds went into the gurnee location around 830pm.we waited 20 minutes for a table which was ok for a Saturday night. It took us 30mins to get our drinks.then it took 1hr to get our food.the waitress only had 4 tables to take care of. It then took 40mins  to get our bill.The staff was slow,horrible, unprofessional. Me and my friends will never go again. Worst experience ever!!!

I love fridays but after tonights service im fucking distraught .Our service was lousy and after eating ghost pepper wings what we received for water was one cup for two of us with lemons that looked like they were playing hopscotch with them mothafuckas before they put in our one gawddamn glass.what a fucking waste of water .im pissed to the highest pistivity of pissed...what in THE fuck .....

Had awesome server named Kat ! Was super entertaining when my son was meowing to her :) she said it is normal and we had a great time !! Made sure to say have a good night meow !! :) had spicy shrimp it was very good .

Emails, commercials, and even a posting on this specific locations personal facebook page that ENDLESS APPS ARE BACK. This location is not participating. Manager was condescending when asking us "what the problem is" when our newly hired server Jens (his words, he had been there 3 weeks) had no idea what we were talking about. I asked if this is the first time they are not participating and the manager said yes. So I'd imagine we weren't the only customers to come in and expect this since we have literally gone countless times before. No apology for the false advertisement on the T.G.I.Fridays Gurnee facebook page. Service lacked, drinks weren't refilled. Not a great experience.

Looks like TGI Friday's has changed their menu some for the good. Now serving Hummus as an app and it is excellent. They still need to add some more healthy options, but what they have is very good. Service very good at the Gurnee one. Always a wait, but I guess that is a good sign!

In here it's always Friday...but in my case, it was a Saturday night and fairly crowded.  I have 4 kids (and an amazing wife), so it is difficult for us to get seating on weekends when we try to go out.  Nevertheless, the great staff at TGI Fridays was extremely accomodating. Service was quick and friendly.  Food was made to order and portions were substantial.  I had the always delicious Jack Daniel's burger and my wife had a seafood pasta dish which smelled like a dumpster (nobody ever says, MMMMMmmmmmmmmmm...smells like fish in a positive way), but was extremely tasty. Kids meals are varied and mandarin oranges are an optional side. Bottom Line:  Good service.  Good food.  Generally crowded, so leave plenty of time or call ahead.

Smells like my Grandfather's basement. AKA musty and mildewy. Yuck!!! If that wasn't bad enough, the food was nothing greater than mediocre, but the prices were that of a quality restaurant! Wouldn't recommend.
I love the Fridays in Gurnee. I usually sit at the bar and always have great service and the drinks are great :)
Horrible service, and the food was not good, will never go back again! In order to deliver a good experience you have to get it together! make you guest/customers want to come back!

Went there for dinner tonight. Service was extremely slow. I ordered a goose island 312. What they brought was definitely not a 312. Very likely a Miller Lite or some sort of cheap American Lager. I told them about it and they promised me I was wrong. Maybe their kegs were mixed up but I was definitely forced to over pay for crap beer.
I wish i can give it more stars!    My husband and i love this place. The drinks are great and the prices are reasonable. I will eat here every day!!!
Service was lacking...they forgot our spinach dip and lemon water.  Food was good, we cancelled our appetizer and manager offered us free appetizer next time we come in.

Great food and service with a smile every time! Great place to go grab a quick bite to eat or an awesome drink and appetizers with some friends! Always had a great experience here! Managers are super friendly and come by just to ask about overall quality. The extra step that shows they have pride and care about their product as a whole.
Fridays is always good to me. They get the orders right, the food comes fast and the waiters always hook you up. No complaints.
The food here is always delish, team members are all very personable,  and everything is priced very fairly. And my kids love it,  so I can't go wrong dining here!

TGI Friday's used to be my favorite casual restaurant chain.  Back when I traveled heavily for work (in the late 90s), I would often seek out a Friday's location for those times when I just felt like having something good and reliable.  It seems that at some point, they changed and are now simply average and barely so. For some unknown reason, they removed the host podium.  This creates a rather awkward situation when entering the restaurant as there is no longer a defined place to go to ask for a table.  The last time I went, I was the only one waiting and an employee was on the phone.  I waited for him to finish up and at least acknowledge my presence, but he just hung up and left.  So, now I am left standing there with no one around and no indication of when someone would return.  I suppose that I could have eaten at the bar, but there were a few loud and obnoxious groups already in there and I wasn't in the mood.  I wound up leaving and dining elsewhere. I probably wouldn't have bothered writing a review except for the fact that this isn't the first time this has happened and other experiences at this restaurant have rubbed me the wrong way as well.  Hopefully, they can pull themselves out of their current downward spiral, but until then I will be making extremely rare appearances here.

I have been to several Friday's around the country and for the most part they are all quite the same.  I haven't had any issues with this one either but I really do think their portion size is smaller than others (might not be a bad thing, I suppose).  Their drinks are good but I would avoid Friday evening... tons of Navy boot camp recruit grads

We always go to TGIF for good food and drinks and why not let the hubby watch the game while i steal pieces of his appetizer :). This time we got items from the 2 for 10 and 3 for 12.99 which is a really good deal the food was really tasty and the drinks as well. Love their vanilla bean cheesecake :)
1/2 off appetizers on Fridays!!!! Mai Tai drinks are amazing makes me think I am in the islands!!!!

I really appreciate their drink deals, its different every day of the week. Wife got an ultimate margarita and loved it, around four or six bucks. Their food was delicious, it was clean and a friendly atmosphere - our waiter was really nice, made sure we were well taken care of.

First off in reply to the previous poster, "You ordered steak at Fridays? What did you expect?" Moving on.. Fridays is always good, this location is special because they have these new palm pilot things that the servers use. These little guys make the refills come constantly and speeds up the food process, with dedicated food runners. Fridays is simple you can usualy get anything good and fairly cheap. Just ask yourself, "would i rather eat something like this at a fancier restaurant?" if your answer is yes, then do just that. It is TGI Fridays, not the chateau. Get chicken fingers, burgers, bbq chicken sandwich. Everything is always good and fresh when it comes to your table. Oh yeah, throwback a couple of cocktails while you're there.

Friday's is not my favorite chain. I went here about 7 years ago with my boyfriend at the time. He ordered a steak and when they bought the steak sauce the bottle was empty. My food came out so late I didn't even want it. They tried to give me coupons for a free dessert, but I left them there, with the resolution that I would never return.  Fast forward and I've been there on 3 to 4 separate occasions. So far, it's been ok. Typical Friday's faire....today was my most recent visit, so that is why I decided to review it. I had a bacon cheeseburger. The burger was fine, cooked well enough, but a little on the greasy side. The fries were really good, fresh and hot. I had the Strawberry Lemonade slush to drink, which is also pretty tasty. It was packed with the usual "done with shopping, now let's eat" Gurnee Mills crowd, but we were seated right away.... Nothing against Friday's but had my grandmother not suggested it, I would not have gone there....

T.G.I.Friday's in Gurnee BLOWS ASS! excuse my language! So it was a Friday, valentines weekend, we went there for a steak since BackYardSteakPit had a pretty long wait., I understand that its not the best place for steak, but whatever! we get there and there is some wait, understandable! I asked about the wait, and the nice lady at the door said 20 minutes and my pregnant girlfriend and I agreed to the wait, they put us down in the book, and gave us the pager that was suppose to go off when our table was ready, as we sat around in the waiting area, more people came in and little after they were sitting people, the time has passed, it was now 25 min after we came in , and passed some more, now its about 55 minutes into the wait, then we see this outrageously dressed couple that came in way after we did get seated, I came up to the the same "nice lady" that had given me the pager, and confronted her about them seating people that came in way after us. I gave her back the pager and stated that we sat around for nearly an hour waiting, and we're not gonna wait no more, the same "nice lady" turned to her co worker and said... "Ohh, this is that pager that doesn't work..." so if you don't wanna sit around and wait unnecessary amounts of time for shitty food... don't go there! Next time I would much rather pick McDonald's! the food is about as good as Fridays, since Fridays food sucks anyways, and there is no wait longer than a couple of minutes!

After frequently going here for carry out when working up North, I amaze myself that we keep going back.  When doing carry out they rarely have the order ready on time.  Only 2 times in about 20 visits.  Plus to add insult to injury, they stopped carrying their potstickers, which aside from the drinks (which is often frowned upon while working), were the best thing on the menu.  Boo!

My husband and I were so hyped up to go to Friday's on a Friday. Came hungry, waited as expected, no biggie. We ended up being kinda disappointed by all the "safe" options on the menu as I would call them. Pretty much means something I could easily make myself at home and wouldn't care to order when out to eat. So, I ordered the chicken piccata pasta dish, which sounded great and cool since its a spin on one of my favorite dishes. My husband ordered the appitizer plater (should have realized ahead of time that was an obvious mistake). The pasta dish literally looked like a noodle soup when it came. It tasted fine, just incredibly soupy and I soon regretted not sending it back. My husband said several time that if he had bought the Friday's brand freezer food at the grocery store and baked them himself, they would have been significantly better than what he got at the restaurant. That's real sad. Our server, he was super awesome, and attentive. He could tell we were dissatisfied, even though we weren't keen at all on making a stink. When we turned down the to-go boxes, he made a point to ask what had been lacking. I politely explained how the dishes missed the mark in a few ways. So, I'd say, everything was good or great, except the food. The food kinda sucked. I always thought the advantage to chains is consistency and control of flavor. Not so.
